page.title: 15Whitelands Farm
page.content: Whitelands Farm is owned by{Mrs {Owen}and covers an area of 50 acres. Her main income comes from breeding sheep. She keeps 98{Mule sheep,}these are a cross breed between a{Blue Faced {Leicester Ram}and a{Wensleydale.}Forty {Dorsets}are kept as well as fifteen rare breed {Black Welsh Mountain sheep. All pure breeds have ear tags with their date of birth and breed. At lambing time{Mrs Owen}is up every 3 hours to look after the new lambs. This year there were 230. The {Dorsets}lamb 3 times in two years, the August lambs being fattened for Christmas. The{Dorset ewes}prove good mothers with plenty of milk. {Mrs Owen}runs the farm singlehanded calling in contractors for the shearing. This is done by touring New Zealanders. The fleeces fetch about Â£3.50 each at market.
